p: Acetonic extract of the plant leaves was investigated against instar larvae and pupae of Spodoptera litura. Studies showed that pesticidal activity happened by causing toxicity, reduced transformation of larval-pupal, and adult intermediates. Thus, W. somnifera can be used as an insect growth regulator, which caused disruption at molting and metamorphosis stage of growth ( 147). Aqueous extract of leaves, stem, and roots of the plants was investigated for herbicidal activity against Ageratum coenyzoides, Chenopodium album, and Achyranthus aspera. It was established that aqueous extract of leaves is a more potent herbicid than stem and root extracts ( 154).
